title: AbstractFileSourceInfo
description: A schema fragment to describe file source information.

FileSource.title: File Source
FileSource.description: The location of the file. It can be a relative path. The actual access is provided via the File Service. When used in context of a FileCollection (dataset--FileCollection*) FileSource is a relative path from the FileCollectionPath. It can be used by consumers to pull an individual file if they so choose by concatenating the FileCollectionPath with the FileSource. This property is required.

PreloadFilePath.title: Preload File Path
PreloadFilePath.description: File system path to the data file as it existed before loading to the data platform.

PreloadFileCreateUser.title: Preload File Create User
PreloadFileCreateUser.description: Optional user name or reference, who created the file prior to up-loading to the platform.

PreloadFileCreateDate.title: Preload File Create Date
PreloadFileCreateDate.description: Optional create date and time of the file prior to up-loading to the platform.

PreloadFileModifyUser.title: Preload File Modify User
PreloadFileModifyUser.description: Optional user name or reference, who last modified the file prior to up-loading to the platform.

PreloadFileModifyDate.title: Preload File Modify Date
PreloadFileModifyDate.description: Optional last modified date and time of the file prior to up-loading to the platform.

FileSize.title: File Size
FileSize.description: Length of file in bytes. Implemented as string. The value must be convertible to a long integer (sizes can become very large).

EncodingFormatTypeID.title: Encoding Format Type ID
EncodingFormatTypeID.description: Only used in FileCollection where the EncodingFormatType differs from data DatasetDefault specified in data.EncodingFormatTypeID: the media type specification for this dataset.

Checksum.title: Checksum
Checksum.description: Checksum of file bytes - a hexadecimal number with even number of bytes.

ChecksumAlgorithm.title: Checksum Algorithm
ChecksumAlgorithm.description: The name of the checksum algorithm e.g. MD5, SHA-256.
